*My opinion â¤ï¸

Didn't think in a million years that I'll write on wars... 

What a crazy world.

Peace to all!
â˜®ï¸â¤ï¸ğŸ’ https://t.co/D5VWtDOWAK

I've seen & (unfortunately) participated in wars and I know it's not the solution!

I wish Ukraine & Russia one thing,

Peace! â˜®ï¸

â¤ï¸ğŸ’

Again,
I'm not naive and I know it isn't an approach that can work (yet), but extreme times make you think...

That's one of the differences that web3 will bring to the world - Global Decision Making.

I believe in the kindness of ppl, so I choose the
Wisdom of Crowds.

There's a subtle difference between the two approaches, but it's an important one.

Remember. Sometimes ppl at the top are "good", but they can be "bad" as well. 

We need a system that can handle both cases. 

You can never know on which side your children will be in a century.

In the future sanctions will be done by deciding not to trade/accept another entity's funds.

Thanks to the blockchain's provenance you can easily trace it & execute upon it!

In practice, if enough entities participate, the sanctions will be the same - frozen funds.  

But...

I'm against WAR and I'm not naive... but!

Freezing funds of individuals/countries don't make sense. It implicitly says that a group of ppl can decide what/who's "good" & who's "bad".

And that's bad...

Future sanctions will look different!
